lastfm.summary: In 2003, the American rock band the Ataris released a punk rock and pop-punk cover of "The Boys of Summer" on their fourth studio album So Long, Astoria. It became their second single when a radio station began to play it. The single peaked at No. 2 on the Billboard Modern Rock Chart (held off the No. 1 top spot by Linkin Park's "Faint") and No. 20 on the Billboard Hot 100. It remains their most successful single.
